column4: jpt={{tt|Wealth Seed|Adds a dakuten diacritic to "ko" 「こ」
column15: effect=Causes extra [[Poké]] piles to spawn on the next floor. Does not work in [[Aegis Cave]]. Restores {{DL|Statistic|Belly}} by 5. Lookalike for {{DL|Seed|Doom Seed}}.
column16: descmds=A food item that makes more Poké appear on the next floor. It also somewhat fills the Pokémon's Belly. It is a Lookalike Item for the Doom Seed
column17: but this is one mistake you'll be very happy to make!

column14: effect=Decreases the user's line of vision and restores {{DL|Statistic|Belly}} by 5. Lookalike for {{DL|Seed|Eyedrop Seed}}.
column15: descmds=A food item that gives the [[Status condition (Mystery Dungeon)#Visibility-related status conditions|Dropeye status]]
column16: where the immediate surrounding area will be dark
column17: even in rooms. It also somewhat fills the Pokémon's Belly. It is a Lookalike Item for the Eyedrop Seed.

column4: jpt={{tt|Outlook Glasses|Replaces the handakuten diacritic with dakuten diacritic
column14: effect=Makes Pokémon be more likely to be hit. Lookalike for {{DL|Glasses|Goggle Specs}}.
column15: descmds=A held item makes the Pokémon stand out
column16: making it easier to hit by enemies. It looks a lot like the Goggle Specs
column17: so be careful not to confuse them!

column13: effect=Gives the user the [[Status condition (Mystery Dungeon)#Battle status conditions|Endure status]] after a quick scene. Lookalike for {{DL|Throwing item|Geo Pebble}}.
column14: descmds=This item has a nostalgic feel and causes the user to bring to mind a dearly held memory When this item is used
column16: and the user sobs and switches to Enduring status. A Lookalike Item for Geo Pebble.

column4: jpt={{tt|Gorōso Stone|One character away from "Graveler (Gorōn) Stone"
column5: replacing the character for "n" 「ン」 with the very similar "so" 「ソ」}}
column16: effect=A food item that raises the [[IQ]] of {{p|Sudowoodo}} or {{p|Bonsly}} by 10 and restores 10 {{DL|Statistic|Belly}}. If eaten while full
column17: maximum Belly goes up by 5. Lookalike for {{DL|Throwing item|Gravelerock}}.
column20: it somewhat fills the Pokémon's Belly. It permanently raises the IQ of a team member. It only affects Bonsly and Sudowoodo. It is a Lookalike Item for Gravelerock
column21: so be sure to check carefully before using it!

column5: is one letter away from Massuguma (Linoone)
column6: while being a mixup of Makkusu (Max) by swapping 「ク」 and 「ス」 around
column7: while also adding dakuten diacritic to 「ク」
column19: effect=A food item that fully restores [[PP]] of all of a {{p|Linoone}}'s moves and restores 5 {{DL|Statistic|Belly}}. Lookalike for {{DL|Health drink|Max Elixir}}.
column20: descmds=A drink that restores the PP of all moves
column21:
but only for Linoone.
It also slightly fills the Pokémon's Belly. It is a Lookalike Item for the Max Elixir. Remember
column22: it can only be used on Linoone

column15: items in the [[Treasure Bag]] will start to turn sticky. Lookalike for {{DL|Scarf (Mystery Dungeon)|No-Stick Cap}}.
column17: occasionally items in your Treasure Bag will become sticky. It looks a lot like the No-Stick Cap
column18: so be careful not to confuse them!

column4: jpt={{tt|Oreso Fruit|One character away from "Oran Berry (Oren Berry)"
column5: replacing the character for "n" 「ン」 with the very similar "so" 「ソ」}}
column16: effect=A food item that deals 10 damage and restores {{DL|Statistic|Belly}} by 5. Lookalike for [[Berry#In the Pokémon Mystery Dungeon series|Oran Berry]].
column17: descmds=A food item that deals damage. It also somewhat fills the Pokémon's Belly. It is a Lookalike Item for the Oran Berry

column4: jpt={{tt|Pevival Seed|Adds a handakuten diacritic to "fu" 「ふ」
column15: effect=Revives a Pokémon; then the Pokémon faints with laughter. Can only be used on Pokémon with the Item Master [[IQ]] Skill. Becomes a {{DL|Seed|Plain Seed}} after use. Lookalike for {{DL|Seed|Reviver Seed}}.
column16: descmds=An item that revives a fainted Pokémon...right? And after reviving? It becomes a {{DL|Seed|Plain Seed}} after use. It can only be used by a Pokémon that knows the Item Master IQ Skill. It is a Lookalike Item for the Reviver Seed

column14: effect=Allows user to walk on water and restores {{DL|Statistic|Belly}} by 5. Lookalike for {{DL|Seed|Sleep Seed}}.
column15: descmds=A food item that gives the Slip status
column16: where it is possible to walk on water. It also somewhat fills the Pokémon's Belly. It is a Lookalike Item for the Sleep Seed
column17: but you'll be pleasantly surprised when you make a mistake on this one!

column14: effect=Makes the user say "See-ya!" and warp to a different place on the floor. Restores {{DL|Statistic|Belly}} by 5. Lookalike for {{DL|Seed|Vile Seed}}.
column15: descmds=A food item that causes the user to say
column16: "See ya!" and warp elsewhere on the floor. It also slightly fills the Pokémon's Belly. It is a Lookalike Item for the Vile Seed

column14: effect=Causes [[Status condition (Mystery Dungeon)#Visibility-related status conditions|Blinker]] status. Lookalike for {{DL|Gummi|Wonder Gummi}}.
column16: this item causes the user eyes to become gunky
column17: and the user gets Blinker status. A Lookalike Item for Wonder Gummi

column4: jpt={{tt|Oversight Glasses|Swaps around the position of 「と」 and 「お」
column14: effect=Disables the ability to see items and enemies. If held by an enemy or an ally
column15: they will receive the [[Status condition (Mystery Dungeon)#Visibility-related status conditions|Blinker status]] which causes them to walk forward in a straight line and attack if it cannot move any further. Lookalike for {{DL|Glasses|X-Ray Specs}}.
column16: descmds=When the leader is holding this
column17: items and enemies won't appear on the map. If anyone else holds this
column18: they will be affected by the Blinker status. It looks a lot like the X-Ray Specs
column19: so be careful not to confuse them!
